Title: "Managing Azure Search Indexes and Document Uploads with PowerShell"

String",                    "searchable":  true,                    "filterable":  false,                    "retrievable":  true,                    "sortable":  true,                    "facetable":  false,                    "key":  false,                    "indexAnalyzer":  null,                    "searchAnalyzer":  null,                    "analyzer":  null,                    "synonymMaps":  ""                },. . . TipFor verification, you could also check the Indexes list in the portal.To push documents, use an HTTP POST request to your index's URL endpoint.
The RESTAPI for this task is Add, Update, or Delete Documents.1. Paste this example into PowerShell to create a $body object containing thedocuments you want to upload.This request includes two full and one partial record. The partial recorddemonstrates that you can upload incomplete documents. The @search.
actionparameter specifies how indexing is done. Valid values include upload, merge,mergeOrUpload, and delete. The mergeOrUpload behavior either creates a newdocument for hotelId = 3, or updates the contents if it already exists.PowerShell2 - Load documents$body = @"{    "value": [    {    "@search. action": "upload",    "HotelId": "1",    "HotelName": "Secret Point Motel",    "Description": "The hotel is ideally located on the main commercial artery of the city in the heart of New York.
